___e1-start.description: the token index that marks the start of e1

___relation.description: The type of relation that holds between e1 and e2.  Values found in the corpus: "E1 precedes E2" (causal precedence), "E2 precedes E1" (causal precedence), "E1 subsumes E2" (E1 is a more specific or complete mention of E2), "E2 subsumes E1" (E2 is a more specific or complete mention of E1), "Equivalent" (the event mentions are equivalent), "Bug" (the extracted mentions incorrect), "None" (no relation holds), "Other" (some other relation holds)

___coref.description: whether or not the annotation involves coreference resolution

___cross-sentence.description: whether or not the two event mentions being compared are in different sentences

___text.description: the text encompassing the two event mentions and their antecedents (if resolved through coreference)

___e1-trigger-start.description: the token index that marks the start of e1's trigger

___e1-trigger-end.description: the token index that marks the end of e1's trigger

___annotator-id.description: an id that identifies the annotator (ex. email address)

___paper-id.description: a unique identifier for the paper (PMID) from which this event pair was extracted

___e1-tokens.description: the list of tokens in e1

___e2-tokens.description: the list of tokens in e1

___e2-trigger-end.description: the token index that marks the end of e2's trigger

___e2-start.description: the token index that marks the start of e2

___e2-end.description: the token index that marks the end of e2

___e2-trigger-start.description: the token index that marks the start of e2's trigger

___id.description: a unique identifier for this annotation

___e1-end.description: the token index that marks the end of e1
